publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-09-23T13:02-0400

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Glenn Jenkins was a part-time student, hospital worker and self-described revolutionary living in Wisconsin in the early 1970s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This unprocessed collection includes correspondence, leaflets, reports, position papers and journals relating to the Socialist Workers Party, Revolutionary Marxist Group, Communist Party, International Socialists, National Caucus of Labor Committees (NCLC), Revolutionary Union, Workers League, Revolutionary Socialist League, Students for a Democratic Society, the Health Policy Advisory Center (Health/PAC) and various other organizations.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is unprocessed and is not available to researchers at this time.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain in 2100. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.
